title: handle leak in tcp connections (windows)
body:
by **loteroc**: 
1. Run the program attached (open/close tcp connection forever).
1. TCP Handles in the program attached (open/close tcp connections forever) keeps
growing and eventually the program crash. 
2. TCP connections are properly managed.

What is the expected output?
Run forever.

What do you see instead?
TCP Handles in the program attached (open/close tcp connections forever) keeps growing
(as reported by Sysinternals Process Explorer) and eventually the program crash. However
TCP are properly closed.

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
8g

Which operating system are you using?
Windows

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
gowin32_2010-12-22.zip
Attachments: 1. stress_tcp.go (1051 bytes)
